data.title: Unscrambling the Quantum Omelette
data.meta_description: Based on recent theorems about quantum value-indefiniteness it is conjectured that many issues of "Born's quantum mechanics" can be overcome by supposing that only a single pure state exists; and that the quantum evolution permutes this state.
data.text:
Abstract

Based on recent theorems about quantum value-indefiniteness it is conjectured that many issues of "Born's quantum mechanics" can be overcome by supposing that only a single pure state exists; and that the quantum evolution permutes this state.

Publication:

International Journal of Theoretical Physics

Pub Date:

October 2014

DOI:

10.1007/s10773-013-1995-3

arXiv:

arXiv:1206.6024

Bibcode:

2014IJTP...53.3648S

Keywords:

Quantum measurement theory;

Mixed state;

Quantum probability;

Quantum Physics

E-Print:

6 pages, 2 figures, presented at the "LARSIM/QuPa workshop," Paris, June 28-29, 2012, at "Quantum Structures Cagliari 2012," Cagliari, Sardinia, July 23-27, 2012, as well as at "New Directions in the Foundations of Physics 2013," Washington, D.C., May 10-12, 2013
